definition: (onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to utter a word/to make a sound/to cheep/to squeak/also pr. [zi1 sheng1]

sentences.english: The steps of the old house groaned under my weight.
sentences.chinese: 我的体重使老房子的楼梯吱嘎作响。

sentences.english: With nearly every stride, our feet crunch spent rifle cartridges.
sentences.chinese: 几乎每走一步，脚下用过的步枪子弹都会吱嘎作响。

sentences.english: I opened it with a creak, and the crying stopped.
sentences.chinese: 门吱嘎一声打开了，哭声也停了。
门慢慢地吱扭一声开了。

sentences.english: There is only the swing creaking, that you have just left.
sentences.chinese: 你方才拜别，只有秋千吱嘎作响。

sentences.english: The boat,coming in too close,jarred against the protective edging of the harbour wall.
sentences.chinese: 小船靠得太近，吱嘎作响地撞击着港口护堤上的护边。

sentences.english: He liked to hear the sound of the snow crunching under his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢听脚下白雪发出的嗄吱嗄吱的声音。

sentences.english: He liked to hear the sound of the snow crunching under his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢听脚下白雪发出的嗄吱嗄吱的声音。

sentences.english: The frozen snow crunched under the wheels of our car.
sentences.chinese: 冻雪在我们车轮下吱嘎作响。

sentences.english: Sound off in the comments if you would pick one up.
sentences.chinese: 如果你也想要的话，就在评论里吱一声吧。

sentences.english: The sky goes jrrrjrrjrrrrjrrr and rolls up, and you can see heaven above it.
sentences.chinese: 天空吱吱吱地卷起来，人们可以看到上方的天堂。

definition: (onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
